main event: On November 27, 1956, a witness observed a large orange object with intermittent red flames that exploded and appeared to fall to the ground, resembling pieces of paper in motion.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be larger than the moon,The observation lasted approximately one minute,The witness described the object as having an orange color with red flames,The event was reported shortly after it happened, and various conclusions were drawn about the nature of the object, including possibilities of it being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: one large orange object with red flames
witness description: A civilian observer with a phone conversation report.
